HomePage.heroSub: Toryx implements Rust's proven Ok/Err pattern to eliminate error handling chaos. Build more reliable applications with consistent, predictable error management that scales with your project.

1.title: Inconsistent error handling
1.desc: Every developer on your team handles errors differently, making code reviews a nightmare and bugs inevitable.

2.title: Try-catch hell
2.desc: Nested try-catch blocks turn clean code into unreadable spaghetti, hiding business logic under layers of error handling.

3.title: Silent failures & lost context
3.desc: Errors get swallowed, stack traces disappear, and debugging becomes a guessing game instead of a systematic process.

4.title: No type safety
4.desc: TypeScript can't help you with traditional error handling you're left wondering what exceptions might be thrown and when.
